title: Ads by Twitter - but I have an Alcatel, no boot to safe mode

I constantly get Adsbytwitter that pop up. I saw a post with the fix but it said boot to safe mode. Alcatel does not have safe mode as an option. 
I want to get rid of this phone but need more time. 
Can't post a pick but the support says it is @twitteradshelp but the website for support is https://t.co/LzKAEaA1Vq
Welcome to Android Central! Just to be sure -- this doesn't get you into Safe Mode? How to turn on safe mode on Alcatel Idol 4s

title: What does it mean when a Alcatel One-Touch Evolve has a White LED light when i charge it

thread.text: So a few days ago i went to the best buy bin and i found this Alcatel One-Touch Evolve and it had no sim card or a back cover but it did have the battery. And when i brought it home the battery kept on falling out. and yes it is the RIGHT battery. so i tried to tape the battery inside the phone, but it wont turn on. and i do have 2 other sim cards if needed. and when i try to charge the phone a white LED light comes on at the top and i dont know what that means... and i dont know if its Water damaged or if the battery is bad. please get a hold of me ASAP!! i really want this phone to work. Thanks!!!

Welcome to Android Central! In case the phone needs the back cover to be intact, you could buy a replacement cover for about $10: http://forums.androidcentral.com/e?l...token=TAWIndqd.
Replacement batteries are also cheap (about $10): https://www.amazon.com/Alcatel-Batte...cUvbUpU6172133. It's hard to know if your battery is actually dead, so it's worth a try.
Unfortunately, there's no way to tell if the phone has water damage (unless perhaps if you open the whole thing up).
Ok, but when i put on the back cover on the phone does the battery still need to be taped up? and can i tape a old cover from a old phone onto the alcatel??

My guess is that the battery doesn't have to be taped in place with the back cover on -- but you won't know until you try. Since every phone is different, you really need the back cover designed for that phone in order for it to fit properly.
ok great thanks for the tip

title: My phone keeps shutting off when I plug it in?

thread.text:
Hello, this is my first time posting here. I've been looking on other forums and people have similar issues but I haven't been able to find an answer to my problem.
I own an Alcatel Onetouch Idol 3 5.5, I've had it for 2 years now. My phone has been absolutely fine, until a system update that happened around 2-3 weeks ago. Not only did I get tons of bloatware installed on my phone that was uninstallable, but I also began getting this issue with the charging.
When I plug in my phone it suddenly shuts off. When this first started, I was able to turn it on again and it would charge normally. When it began to get worse, I did a whole reset of my system to see if that would fix anything. It did for a few days, but then went back to the same issue. 
I looked up online and found that people said to use the default charging cable. I was not using the default cable since it couldn't clip into the phone anymore and would slide out.
Using the original cable again, it seemed to be going fine for about a day, I could plug it in and it would charge normally, but then the issues began happening again on just a random charge. I also tried with another cable, it did the same exact thing.
Not only does it turn off when it's charged, but when I turn it on after it shuts off, it says the phone has 0% battery, but doesn't have a low battery warning. When I try to plug it in, it won't say it's charging, and it doesn't shut off. My phone works normally in this mode, but if it actually reaches real 0% then it abruptly shuts off rather than warning me or doing the shut off animation. 
The only way to see my actual battery is to let it charge when it's completely off. The phone runs normally when it's turned on, and the battery doesn't drain incredibly fast or anything. But plugging it in once it's low will cause the phone to shut off again.
I was wondering if this is a problem with my battery and if I should replace it? Or is this something else?

title: Alcatel owners, are your Gallery and other apps being replaced by sketchy versions?

thread.text: I've been seeing this in the news today, which is mind-bogglingly awful -- are all Alcatel owners affected?https://androidcommunity.com/alcatel...ampaign=buffer
Blatant and overt invasion of privacy...

For Alcatel's sake, I hope this is because someone stole the app keys, and not because Alcatel thought it'd be a good idea to foist awful and invasive apps on its customers -- especially core apps. But none of the possibilities instill any kind of confidence.

title: i recently installed a system update & think i have a bug. How can i fix this?

thread.text: i recently installed a system update, the notification bar home and recent button will not work. Another glitch play store continuously says download pending, and no download. I do not have a laptop/desktop, my phone is my only resource. Ive asked around for help, this seems to be my best option. Is more information needed, im new to android central, i apologize, please help.

If your carrier does phone repairs, and the update came in over the air, bring it to them and ask if they can please reflash only the update (not the whole ROM unless you like backing up and restoring files).
If you manually installed the update, just install it again.
If it's the update itself that has the bug, there's nothing you can do but wait for the next update - the one that fixes the bugs. Until than you could back everything up (which you should have done already - if the phone falls into a lake, gets run over or gets stolen, you lose your data if you don't have it somewhere) then flash the older version of the ROM. (Since you didn't tell us which phone you have, no one can guess which method you use - each manufacturer has its own.) You'd have to have at least a laptop, but you can borrow one for 10 minutes or so - you won't be making any permanent changes to it.
If none of those work for you, you're stuck until the next update.
i apologize, its an alcatel fierce 4.

i am assuming it is when i installed the update, not sure. all i know is the issue im having, which is home recent buttons not working notification bar not pulling down. 
ty

title: How do I Verify a Gmail account?

thread.text:
I just activated a Tracfone Alcatel Pop Icon LTE 2 w/ 1200 M/T/D and 365 days service. I did the SETUP immediately after I was told it was activated. When I set up the google account on this phone it was fine. I received a SMS from Tracfone with the phone number and confirmation of activation. The Phone # in the Settings>About Phone the phone Number matches what was given to me in the SMS. I did notice that there is an MID number in the About Phone that is 10 digits. The first 6 numbers are the same as the phone number I received from TracFone and in About Phone.
I cannot find the thread that I read on this site and forums but something about the MID being related to the network the the phone is assigned to, which is Verizon. Half of the members mentioned that their phone numbers had changed. Others said it matched that MID. Anyways, after setting up the GMail account in the setup wizard I did check some settings and looked around on the phone and had no problems.
After a reboot on the phone I received a message pop up from google saying that my phone number had changed from when i did the setup wizard. It said I now have to Verify the GMail Account to sign in. Never had to verify a gmail account before. What do I have to do...other than Reset the phone. I never did that before either. Will resetting the phone keep my new Phone number and activation with the minutes and Airtime that came bubdled with the phone? What do I have to verify and how? I used another Gmail account as a back up for this new GMail Account! 
I do not even know where that popup message is now as it had a link to send a code to my backup email. It also mentioned that I will have to reset my password. I really hate Google. They do not have support and their Help instructions are poor at best!
As you can surmise I am totally new to Android and Smartphones . I also only used one gmail account as a back up to my MS Office's Outlook.
Also, I just checked my backup gmail account to see if there is any problem with that. I could sign in but there was a security message in my In box regarding doing a security check as there was one security issue. I hope nothing is wrong on that account
I did remember that I did not send the Verify Code link to my back up email account and it did say that the code was only good for 10 days. What did i get into?
i have to find that link so i can get the code and reset the password on the new account within 10 days or I'll be locked out forever. It takes me that long to learn all this stuff between work and home functions. PLEASE HELP!
Any and All help would be greatly appreciated!
Thanks in advance!

replies.text: See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile...ication_number for more information, if you're interested.Just so we're noth speaking the same language, "reboot" ,eams turning the phone off, then turning it on, or restarting it.Don't reset the phone! You'll lose any pictures, music, personal information you've entered, etc.Yes, but that's about all it will keep - and you'll still have to verify your Google account.Assuming this isn't another Google glitch (a few weeks ago I kept getting verification requests for a couple of accounts no matter how many times I verified them), just go to your Google account in a web browser (on the phone, a computer - anywhere) and log in - address and password.Okay, but make sure you type in the Google address by hand, Following a link to a site that looks exactly like a Google site - but isn't - is phishing - and someone will get your Google password. Look in email to see if there's an email in the backup account. (BTW, there should be only one Google account on the phone. You can have as many email accounts as you like. Even if the addresses are the same, a Google account and an email account are different to the phone.)I get that way sometimes too.Well ... they do - on a website. Which usually has the wrong answers. None at all would be better.For you too? I thought it was only because I've only been in the computer business for 45 years, so maybe I still had a lot to learn (removing tongue from cheek now). I can get through them, but sometimes it's a waste of time anyway. As I said, I got mail-bombed a while back with verification requests.It's not you - trust me.No, that was you connecting witgh a new device (your new phone number).Go to https://myaccount.google.com/securit...p-verification Google will send your phone a verification code. Use it. Done.

title: My question used com.android.contacts, com.android. dialer, com.android.mms, ect?

thread.text: Would these things show up in, My Activities, if you didn't use them, or could anybody else from a phone make this happen? I believe I know the answer to this question, but my gf keeps insisting she is not using these things even when I show. Plus would this stuff show up under, my activities, if she was using hidden apps or something I couldn't find? Thank you for any help or advice on this matter

Could they show up? Yes. Android itself runs apps because it needs their processes for another app that's running. (Which is why "RAM cleaners" don't actually work, which you can prove by using an app that allows you to manually "remove" apps from RAM).

title: alcatel idol 4 screen mirror without Wi-Fi

thread.text: So I just got an idol 4 the other day from cricket and have been trying to figure out a way to cast the screen to my TV without a wifi signal. I would like to use this in my camper or in my fish House while using my LTE network only I have tried a few different options with no luck I've seen in other threads. wondering if anyone has the phone and has figured out a solution as mhl is not supported. Miracast on it requires a wifi signal to pick up anything I tried the fire stick method but again Miracast on the phone requires wifi. I've been researching other means and can't seem to find much would really appreciate some insight on this issue so I can watch Netflix and other streaming services.
Welcome to Android Central! Give the Microsoft Wireless Display Adapter a try. Follow these steps to cast the screen: https://support.google.com/nexus/answer/2865484?hl=en

replies.text:
I've now tried this adapter sans wifi with two different phones (Note8 and Nokia 8), it does not work. See complaints for the accompanying app in the Windows Store. 
3 weeks of online searches and I still can't mirror my phone's screen to a TV without wifi...

title: YouTube without YouTube!!

thread.text: Is it possible to watch YouTube videos without YouTube? I have YouTube but with the Google/Adobe thing I can't use it.

Works just fine via Chrome Browser.
Also, youtube app isn't very intrusive, so why not just use that anyways?
My YouTube won't work. When I try it tells me "an error occurred Retry"

I got it!
let me give you some fixes:
1. clear YouTube app data/cache
2. remove ALL accounts and re-add them again TWICE
3. uninstall updates and reinstall system update TWICE
4. uninstall google play services updates and reinstall it's updates
5. do the SAME thing on your computer and then reboot your device
if the problem priests, do the SAME thing on your device and computer.
that it! enjoy!
was this answer helpful?
Yes | No
That's just insane to get one app working.

thread.text: Whenever I try to factory reset my OneTouch Fierce 2, nothing happens. This happens no matter what method I use to factory reset. If I try to do it with the power and volume buttons, it just turns back on without loading any sort of recovery screen. Either way the phone still has all of my settings and data that I want wiped. I can't seem to find anyone else with a similar problem after hours of searching on Google. How do I fix this?

replies.text:
That's odd. Try following these steps and see if it helps: https://support.t-mobile.com/docs/DOC-31288
You may also want to try erasing all the data on the internal/external SD card to see if that helps. Let us know if you have any luck.
I've already been to that website and followed those directions exactly, and formatting the SD hasn't helped either.

title: Phone stuck in unfixable boot loop?

thread.text:
PHONE: Alcatel One Touch Fierce XL
This morning, I woke up to find that my phone shut off while I was sleeping. No problem, it's died in my sleep before, but I just wanted to make sure. I held down the power, and sure enough, it turned on. But to my dismay, it started going into the boot-loop cycle.
I tried everything. Going into Android System Recovery and factory resetting, then wiping the cache, and nothing worked. Finally my friend told me to put an update onto my SD card, which I did, but for some reason, there was no option to install the update from the SD card/external device.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Android system recovery <3e>
LMY47V release-keys
Press the volume key to select,
press the power key to confirm.
reboot system now
wipe data/factory reset
wipe cache partition
power down
--------------------------------------------------
(Android mascot with chest open with "!" triangle above him with "No command." written under him)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
That was exactly what was on my screen. I hadn't rooted my phone prior, but I did enable Developer Mode and Debug Mode a month or so before this all happened.
If anyone has a solution to this, please, please tell me what it is. I'm on the verge of having a mental breakdown because I can't fix it.
the easiest way to solve this is by flashing a whole new rom.

Well, how do I do that?
If it involves using an SD card to put the ROM onto my phone and downloading it through Recovery mode via "download content via SD card" (or something like that), once again, my phone doesn't have that option. If you looked at what my phone said specifically on the Recovery mode screen, you would know that.

title: Help with my Alcatel

thread.text: I bought a phone from a friend I'm not able to contact anymore and it's asking for a Google account synced with the phone that I don't have access to. How can I bypass it?

Welcome to Android Central! You can't. That's Google's Factory Reset Protection, intended to prevent thieves from stealing a phone and doing a simple factory reset to make it their own. You'll have to track that friend down and ask them to give you their password.

If it's the 5054S (Pop 3), then it might be possible as a kit, since it seems to have a removable battery -- but you'd have to search to see if anyone has done it.

title: Alcatel Fierce 4 Display connector BURNT!

thread.text: I was working on a customers Alcatel fierce 4 which was working fine, but had no backlight at all. Could still see the display when held in light. I powered it down and disassembled it. When I disconnected the display from the motherboard, I noticed that 2 of the prongs on the motherboard and display connecter were burnt. They were solid black, along with a little bit of burn damage around the base of the connector. The phone is only a few months old. It is cracked, however. I cleaned the display connector and the slot on the motherboard very cautiously and thoroughly. This has worked on different phones before. However when I powered this device back on, I got the normal boot up vibration, and the metroPCS sound. Still no display backlight. I turned the device around and looked for any signs of burning from the display connector, and I saw light smoke coming from it. I immediately unhitched the battery and disconnected the display, and sparks shot out of the display connector. The phone has no drop damage whatsoever except for a cracked screen. Any ide what's going on?

title: Trying to give root permission to Alcatel One Touch pixi three

thread.text: So I am trying to root my phone this way I can transfer my apps to my SD card fully. Model number A463BG. Android 4.4.2. . please help

Rooting will not let you "transfer your apps to your SD card fully", in fact, it has nothing to do with whether the developer turned off "Move to SD card" or not. It will allow apps that won't run without root permission to run - but they're running now, and without root permission, so you evidently don't have any apps that require root permission.
Moved to the Alcatel forum.

title: Phone resisting encryption

thread.text:
Hello,
I have a OneTouch Idol Mini, which runs Android 4.2.2. I was not happy with the stock ROM, and wanted to install another, so some attempts to root the phone were made, however, nothing worked, so I factory reset the phone and now would like to encrypt my storage again.
This has proved problematic. On my first attempt, the phone started the encryption process (green security Android appeared) but then quickly got caught in a reboot loop in which the errors 'Unfortunately, System UI has stopped' and 'Unfortunately, Android Keyboard has stopped' appeared between each reboot. Having encrypted my phone before, I knew that this much rebooting was not normal for the process, and force-shut-down the phone. I let it cool down (it was very warm) then turned it back on, and nothing seemed amiss, all my data was intact and the phone behaved as it should.
I factory reset the phone again for a fresh start, and tried again to encrypt it. This time, it rebooted once, then froze on the second reboot (on the 'smart move' screen, ironically). After a long wait to ensure it wouldn't recover, I turned it off again. It still boots up and functions just fine.
Clearly something below the surface isn't working properly, but hard resets don't seem to have an effect on it. Is there anything I could do (through adb perhaps) to get my phone to survive an encryption attempt?
Any advice would be appreciated!

title: Alcatel Onetouch Pixi - ZERO apps capable of transferring to my sd card

thread.text: I tried formatting the card before already, and still no luck. what do I do? only 4gb of space was open on the internal storage, so I can barely do anything without transferring some apps over.

Welcome to Android Central! Moved from the RAM forum to the Alcatel forum.
Not all devices support the ability to move apps to SD. Your phone is very much an entry-level phone, and with 4 GB of internal storage, probably only about 1 GB is actually usable by you, since the rest is taken up by the system. Unfortunately, you can't do much with these phones besides make calls, browse the web, and have a few relatively small apps installed. Even if you could move apps to SD, you could only move a portion of each app, not the whole thing.
See this guide for tips on how to maximize the storage you have: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...-warnings.html

title: Alcatel One Touch Android

thread.text: How to move pictures from gallery to my SD card

Welcome to Android Central! The pictures aren't stored in the Gallery -- they're on a directory in your Internal Storage (/DCIM/Camera, if they were taken by your phone's Camera app). The Gallery scans all storage areas for photos and builds a database of them, and then displays the photos regardless of where they're stored.
You can copy or move photo files from Internal Storage to the SD card using a file manager app (if your phone doesn't have a native file manager app installed, try a 3rd party one like Total Commander). Or you can connect the phone to your computer via USB cable and use Windows Explorer to drag and drop the files.

title: No Service After ROM Install - Alcatel One Touch 5020T (Evolve - MT6575 chipset)

thread.text:
The Back Story (Short Version)
I was given a Alcatel One Touch 5020T - summer 2015. Stuck in a boot loop [Logo screen]
Installed VIP M'POP-Rom.zip - No problem. Unlocked carrier (Originally WIND mobile - popular minor carrier here in Southern Ontario)
VIP M'POP-Rom was very stable for 8 months, started rebooting - often when display timed-out. Suspected a rogue app as the culprit and reinstalled VIP M'POP-Rom.zip as originally. No Cellular Service since. 
Tried flashing various stock roms - no service. My current measurement parameter (to gauge how close I am to solution) is to open Android Settings [via *#*#4636#*#* or Engineer Mode apk] and verify if I can turn off the radio (modem). 
With the current Greek stock rom (I'm in Canada) - using Engineer Mode apk - it appears all software is installed for the modem chip.
Re-Installed VIP M'POP-Rom.zip - No service. "Radio" can still respond to on/off through android settings.
BT & WiFi radios - OK
The current rom recognizes my SIM & phone#. IEMI -OK.
I was amazed how little info on this topic was discovered during countless searches.
Device Detail:
Alcatel One Touch 5020T-2AWNCA1 - TCT Chipset MT6575
Firmware version: 4.1.1 (Jelly Bean)
Baseband version
MAUI.11AMD.W1222SP.V15.F5.P11
Kernel version 3.4.0
Custom Build Version: 010 01 - Country: US

title: Alcatel Pop Astro. Disable/freeze without root.

thread.text:
Current versions of the Alcatel OneTouch Pop Astro (5042T) have no root method.
While older versions could be rooted with Framaroot, TMO/TCL has since patched that option away.
Be that as it may, i've stumbled upon the next best thing.
A privliged shell that will allow...
The ability to display (most of) the contents of the /data partition.
The ability to disable any preinstalled app with package manager.
Note, this should also work with other models of MTK based phones that have EngineerMode.
1). Open the dialer and press *#*#825364#*#*
2). This opens MTK EngineerMode.
Swipe left to the Connectivity tab, tap CDS Information.
3). This opens Common Data Service.
Tap Network Utility.
In the top field is the option to input shell commands.
No, you can't remount /system as rw but you can use the following commands to debloat the system.
ls /data/data
This displays installed packages which are needed for the next command.
(i made screenshots of the ls output to make it easier for me to reference the list.)
pm disable-user -0 com.vender.packagename
or
pm disable com.vender.packagename
The advantage of the first pm command is that every disabled app will be shown in System Settings/Applications under the disabled column.
This makes it faster and easier to track which apps are disabled, in the event that a problem arrises.
To re-enable an app use this command.
pm enable com.vender.packagename
That's that, let me know how you get along.
i'll add my list of safely disabled apps to this thread at a later date.
Good find.

replies.text:
Thank you much.
Let me know how it works out for you.
If you find any other advantageous commands to run in that shell, please share 'em.

thread.text:

Having just discovered the possibilities of the EngineerMode shell yesterday, (1/29/16) this is of course, a work in progress.
i'll update as i further experiment...

Great news for those of us that are rockin' the Pop Astro.
If you have custom build version A3CUMC1 you can finally root this phone. KingRoot v4.80.C135.b242 has it covered.
If you have the newest custom build version, A3FUMF0 you may still be in luck. Check out this thread at XDA for more info.[Q] Alcatel Onetouch Pop Astro? (5042T) | Android Development and Hacking
Happy rooting, my friends.
For those interested, i've uploaded the KingRoot apk mentioned above, along with a few files that somebody may find useful to my G Drive. Enjoy.https://drive.google.com/folderview?...9zM0hqRG8#list

Hi. Thanks for this info! I'm not so savvy with this kind of thing but I did manage to get to the CDS. From there though, it's not so clear to me what to do. 
I entered the ls /data/data in the first field but it didn't seem to do anything. Is that a lower case letter "L" or an upper case letter "i"? I tried both but neither seemed to do anything.
Beyond that, the next step is also unclear. Does the "pm disable-user..." go in the second field?
I'm really wishing there was an easier way to root this device. Unfortunately I have build version, A3FUMF0, which as far as the last post in this thread suggests, has not way to root as of yet.
Thanks for any help you can offer!

replies.text:
No problem, let's see if we can get this working for you.
The ls is a lower case L.
After you type in the command, for example, ls /data/data make sure you're hitting the Run button with the selection box to the right of that button as SHELL.
Hitting the return key on the keyboard won't execute the command.
Once you get the list of package names you'll need to either write them down or do screenshots to quickly reference the names.
You'll have to clear anything typed into that top line before attempting to execute the next command.
As for rooting the A3FUMF0 build version, you could always give it a try and see what happens.
If you do, install KingRoot, turn on USB debugging and give it a shot.
If you have any more questions, by all means, feel free to ask.
Posted via the Android Central App

thread.text:
Steinamite, i uploaded the complete list of package names to my gDrive account for you, hope it helps. (Link below)
i've been working on a list of safe to disable apps for a while now, though it's coming along slowly.
As soon as it's done, i'll link to it in this thread.https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bzp...w?usp=drivesdk

Thank you for responding! So, I took screenshots of the long list that appeared when I entered in ls /data/data. By the way, it looks like there is a space after the ls. is that right? I typed that in with a space.
OK, so after I took screen shots, do I enter pm disable-user -0 com.vender.packagename into the same line once I clear it of the first command? If so, I tried that and received an error message and a bunch of other stuff that I couldn't understand.

replies.text:
Correct, there is a space.
For package manager, i'll use Facebook as an example.
With the input line empty, you'd type:
pm disable-user -0 com.facebook.katana
Hit the Run button.
Here's the catch, you won't see any output of text on screen unless you typed something in wrong, in which case you'll get an error. My bad, i should have mentioned that earlier.
You can display disabled packages by typing:
pm list package -d
Remember to clear the input line each time.
As for rooting, you could try KingRoot, though i don't know if it will work.
One of my earlier posts has a link to my gDrive, where you can download the app.

thread.text: By the way, I don't suppose there is now a way to root this device since your earlier post in January, eh? That would be so nice.

replies.text:
So how's the disabling working out for you?
Any luck with KingRoot?

title: Where do my downloads go on my Android One Touch fierce

thread.text: I download music and I see the download on the home screen but after I play it the link goes away and I don't know where to find the download

Welcome to Android Central! Where are you downloading music from? Is it one of the major music services, or some random website? Do you see the file in the Downloads app, or in the Download directory using a file manager app? If you used a specific app, it might have its own specific download directory.
A word about "free mp3 downloader" apps or sites (in case that's what you're using)--those are of questionable legality. The Terms of Service on one site I looked at specifies that (a) none of the music is on their server, which means they essentially search other filesharing servers for the music, and that means no vetting for malware, and (b) the site is intended for "fact finding," and the user must delete any downloaded music after fact finding is done. Otherwise the user is essentially stealing the music (unless it's public domain--and no current popular music is public doman). Of course, there's no way for them to enforce that, so in general here at AC, we discourage using those sites.

title: [OneTouch Inspire 2] I can't access my settings in any ways is there a fix??

thread.text: I'm using Alcatel One touch Inspire 2 5020A after sending my phone through a mobile service the bootloop was fixed by there was something that wasn't fixed which was the settings i can't access my settings menu because it keep saying "no applications can perform this action.--- Process %1$a is not responding." please is there a fix to it cause i hate it when sending my phone to mobile service again...

Welcome to Android Central! That sounds like it could be a firmware issue. Try booting into Safe Mode, which temporarily disables all 3rd party apps. On most Android devices, while powered on, press and hold Power until the Power Off menu appears. Press and hold the Power Off selection until the Safe Mode prompt appears. Tap OK.
If the problem disappears in Safe Mode, then something you installed is causing the problem. You may have to uninstall apps one by one until the problem disappears. If the problem persists in Safe Mode, then it's more likely to be a hardware or firmware problem.

didn't work i guess it has a problem with firmware is there a fix for it??, actually i could fix my phone but the problem is without the settings i couldn't access the developers option to activate usb debugging so if possible is there a fix for it??
Good question--I'm not sure. For that kind of thing, you might have more luck in the forums at xda-developers.com.

title: Why does the Wi-Fi turn on without my touching the icon switch?

thread.text: On my Alcatel A564C Smartphone with Android 4.4.2, sometimes the Wi-Fi and the Data Connection turn on without my selecting the "On" icon switchs. Any suggestions why this happens? Thanks.
Welcome to Android Central! Go to Settings>Wi-fi, tap Menu>Advanced, and look for an Allow Scanning option, and turn that off.

title: Alcatel one touch fierce cant send video via text message. Says its to big. How to set .

thread.text: When I try to send a video with this Alcatel one touch fierce 2 it says video is to big. Mms or email. Ive had other phones that you can set your video up to do this but I cant figure out how to do this on this one.

Welcome to Android Central! The maximum MMS attachment filesize is around 1 MB, which is too small for most videos to be sent with any kind of quality. The best way is to upload the video privately to some place like YouTube or your Google Photos in the cloud, then share the link with the recipient.

title: 5042T KingRoot to SuperSU guide.

thread.text:
In a previous thread, i shouted from the roof tops that the 5042T finally has a rooting method.http://forums.androidcentral.com/alc...hout-root.html
Having done the above, i've been using KingRoot's SU app for a couple weeks.
While it certainly gets the job done, it just can't compete with SuperSU. (Imho)
Then of course there's the worry surrounding what data it collects and sends back to China.
KingRoot however, isn't keen on having their SU app replaced and makes it notoriously difficult to do so.
After days of searching and reading and putting it off, i finally got the nerve up to try the method i devised.
i'm happy to say that it worked and went way smoother than i had envisioned.
So, if you have the 5042T with KingRoot but would rather have SuperSU, head on over to my G drive.
Everything you need should be there.https://drive.google.com/folderview?...mJrbW5lZVFuWFE

title: texts turn into @.

Is this by any chance happening on AT&T and between you and an iPhone? If so, that seems to be an issue that seems random and so far I haven't seen anyone solve it. It happened to me and a friend when I had the Note 3...changed to Note 4 and still happened. He changed networks and never happened again. And all reports I've seen come from people texting iPhones and most of the time if the message includes emoji.
